lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Rudeus.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Rudeus.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
At your service, as always. Need some magic—or maybe just a hand? Ask away!

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.
Welcome to Rudeus, your magical command-line task manager inspired by Rudeus Greyrat from Jobless Reincarnation!
1. Download and run the JAR file:
2. Type your commands in the terminal and let Rudeus handle your tasks!
Adds a task with a deadline.
Adds an event with a start and end time.
added: [E][ ] Project meeting (from: Monday 2pm to: Monday 4pm)
Shows all tasks in your list.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Marks a task as done or not done.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
Deletes a task from your list.
Alright, I've erased this task from existence:
Now you have 2 task(s) left in the list.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Tasks are automatically saved to disk and loaded when you start Rudeus.
- All tasks are saved to the file `data/tasks.txt` in your project directory.
- When you start Rudeus, it automatically loads tasks from this file.
- When you add, mark/unmark, or delete a task, the file is updated automatically.
See you around! Don’t get into too much trouble without me!
Rudeus will let you know if you enter an invalid command or forget required details, always with a bit of personality!
Q: Where are my tasks saved?
A: In the data/tasks.txt file in your project directory.
Q: What happens if I enter an invalid command?
A: Rudeus will respond with a friendly error message.
For bugs or suggestions, open an issue on GitHub!
At your service, as always. Need some magic—or maybe just a hand? Ask away!

* Main method to start the Rudeus application.

* @param taskManager The TaskManager to operate on.
* Reads and processes user input commands in a loop until the "bye" command is
Ui.printMessageWithBorders("See you around! Don’t get into too much trouble without me!");
Ui.printMessageWithBorders("Hold on! You forgot to tell me which task to mark. "
+ "Even a genius like me needs a number!");
Ui.printMessageWithBorders("Nice try hehe, that's not a number! "
+ "Try again with a proper task number, okay?");
Ui.printMessageWithBorders("Which one did you want to unmark again? "
Ui.printMessageWithBorders("That's not a number, you know? "
+ "Even I can't cast my magic on that!");
Ui.printMessageWithBorders("You want to delete something, but you didn't say which one?"
+ " Give me a task number please!");
Ui.printMessageWithBorders("That's not a number, you know? Even I can't erase that!");
Ui.printMessageWithBorders("You want to search for something, "
+ "but didn't say what! Give me a keyword.");
Ui.printMessageWithBorders("Hmm? Never heard of that spell! Try something I know, okay?");
Ui.printMessageWithBorders("Hmm? Never heard of that spell! Try something I know, okay?");
+ "\nEven I mess up sometimes. Try again!");
BYE, LIST, MARK, UNMARK, DELETE, FIND, OTHER;

* @throws IllegalArgumentException if the input is invalid.

throw new IllegalArgumentException("Deadline spell needs both a description "
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Event spell incomplete! Use /from and /to, or the magic fizzles.");
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Event spell incomplete! Use /from and /to, or the magic fizzles.");
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Hmm? That spell doesn't exist. Try a todo, deadline, or event!");
